title: Ultimate Cherry Pie for Holiday Gatherings
promptIMG: Cherry pie, on plate, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus, zero blur throughout entire image, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography, natural sharpness --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --raw --stylize 300
description: This ultimate cherry pie is the perfect centerpiece for your holiday gatherings. With a flaky crust and sweet-tart filling, it's a crowd-pleaser that brings joy to every table. Bake it today and create lasting memories!
ingredients: 2 cups fresh or frozen cherries, pitted
1 tablespoon butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cherries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
Roll out one pie crust and place it in a 9-inch pie pan.
Pour the cherry mixture into the crust and dot with butter.
Roll out the second crust and place it over the filling. Seal and flute the edges.
Cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Brush the top with beaten egg.
Bake for 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling.
tips: For the best results, use fresh cherries when in season and let the pie cool completely before slicing to ensure clean cuts.

structured_content.content: This ultimate cherry pie is a delightful blend of sweet and tart flavors, encased in a perfectly flaky crust. It's a nostalgic treat that evokes memories of family gatherings and celebrations.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour
  • Classic flavors that everyone loves
  • Perfect for holiday gatherings and special occasions
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Can be made ahead and served warm or cold

structured_content.content: Growing up, my family always made cherry pie for Thanksgiving. The aroma of baking pie filled our home, and it became a cherished tradition that I now share with my own family.

• Main ingredient: Fresh or frozen cherries work best for a juicy filling, ensure they are pitted for easy eating.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Sugar balances the tartness, while lemon juice enhances the cherry flavor.
  • Supporting ingredients: Cornstarch thickens the filling, and butter adds richness.
  • Equipment needed: A 9-inch pie pan and rolling pin are essential for this recipe.

upload.context: Preparation of cherries and pie crusts for the cherry pie.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Begin by preheating your oven and preparing the cherry filling while the oven heats.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the steps to assemble the pie and bake until golden brown.
Finishing Touches:
Allow the pie to cool before slicing to let the filling set.

upload.context: Cooking process of the cherry pie in the oven.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure the pie crust is chilled before rolling out for the best texture.
  • Avoid overfilling the pie to prevent spilling over.
  • Look for a bubbling filling and golden crust as signs of doneness.
  • Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cherry pie with loved ones is a joy that brings everyone together, creating moments filled with laughter and happiness.
Add a pinch of cinnamon or almond extract to the filling for an extra layer of flavor that complements the cherries beautifully.
Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or alongside a dollop of whipped cream for a delightful treat.
For a gluten-free option, use a gluten-free pie crust. You can also mix in other berries like blueberries or raspberries for a mixed berry pie.

upload.context: Final plated cherry pie ready to be served.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill your pie crust for at least 30 minutes before use for a flaky texture.
  • Use a mix of sweet and tart cherries for a more complex flavor.
  • Keep an eye on the pie during baking to prevent over-browning.
  • Serve with a sprinkle of powdered sugar for an elegant touch.

structured_content.content: Embrace the joy of baking this cherry pie and share it with those you love. It's a simple yet rewarding experience that will fill your home with warmth and happiness.
